text:
Hi Support,

I get following errors while installing any idea y ?

network_io/unix/sendrecv.c: In function `apr_socket_sendfile':
network_io/unix/sendrecv.c:843: error: `sendfilevec64_t' undeclared (first use
in this function)
network_io/unix/sendrecv.c:843: error: (Each undeclared identifier is reported
only once
network_io/unix/sendrecv.c:843: error: for each function it appears in.)
network_io/unix/sendrecv.c:843: error: `sfv' undeclared (first use in this function)
network_io/unix/sendrecv.c:862: error: `SFV_FD_SELF' undeclared (first use in
this function)
network_io/unix/sendrecv.c:864: warning: cast from pointer to integer of
different size
network_io/unix/sendrecv.c:888: warning: cast from pointer to integer of
different size
*** Error code 1
make: Fatal error: Command failed for target `network_io/unix/sendrecv.lo'
Current working directory /export/home/mohan/httpd-2.2.2/srclib/apr
*** Error code 1
make: Fatal error: Command failed for target `all-recursive'
Current working directory /export/home/mohan/httpd-2.2.2/srclib/apr
*** Error code 1
make: Fatal error: Command failed for target `all-recursive'
Current working directory /export/home/mohan/httpd-2.2.2/srclib
*** Error code 1
make: Fatal error: Command failed for target `all-recursive'
creator: mohanraj.bangera@tcsbelgium.com
chip@force-elite.com
text:
This is on Solaris I assume?

What version of Solaris?

What compiler was used?

Can you please attach the srclib/apr/config.log to this bug report?

creator: mohanraj.bangera@tcsbelgium.com
text:
Created attachment 18475
config logs

Solaris version 8
compiler used was gcc .. 

config file attached.

Please let us know how do we rectify the problem

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
Looks like a mismatch in patches; libc has been patched to support sendfile but
not the headers.  Are all available patches applied?

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text: Close lacking any feedback to indicate this is not just a patch mismatch.
